title: Create Extended Funnel Plots
text: Inspired archived extfunnel package Langan et al. function creates extended funnel plot shaded contours show impact new study certain effect estimate standard error (sample size) conclusions updated meta-analysis. Uses ggplot2 instead base R, allows specification meta-analytic model via metafor package well simulation using sample size per group addition standard error.

title: Create Extended Funnel Plots — extfunnel2
text: Inspired archived extfunnel package Langan et al. function creates extended funnel plot shaded contours show impact new study certain effect estimate standard error (sample size) conclusions updated meta-analysis. Uses ggplot2 instead base R, allows specification meta-analytic model via metafor package well simulation using sample size per group.

title: Create Extended Funnel Plots — extfunnel2
code: extfunnel2(   yi,   sei,   sd = NULL,   n = NULL,   swe,   method = "REML",   test = "z",   contour_points = 50,   x_lim,   y_lim,   x_lab = "Effect size",   y_lab = "Standard error",   x_ticks = NULL,   y_ticks = NULL,   legend_pos = "right",   legend_just = NULL,   exp = FALSE )

title: Create Extended Funnel Plots — extfunnel2
text: yi numeric vector effect estimates study. Odds/ risk ratios log-transformed. sei numeric vector standard errors study. Must specified. 'sd' 'n' specified y-axis correspond standard error. sd single numeric value corresponding assumed standard deviation per group future study. 'sd' 'n' specified y-axis correspond sample size per group. works mean differences. n numeric vector average sample size per group study. needed 'sd' specified. swe single numeric value corresponding smallest worthwhile effect. Odds/ risk ratios log-transformed. method character string indicating method used estimate tau. Default "REML". See rma metafor package options. test character string indicating method use calculate confidence intervals. Default "z". See rma metafor package options. contour_points numeric value indicating number contour points used simulation. Default 50. high quality contours 500 recommended. takes long time 250.000 (500x500) meta-analyses run (one contour point equates one meta-analysis). x_lim numeric vector two values indicating lower upper limits simulated effect estimates (corresponds x-axis limits). Odds/ risk ratios log-transformed. y_lim numeric vector two values indicating lower upper limits simulated standard errors (corresponds y-axis limits). 'sd' 'n' provided 'y_lim' corresponds lower upper limits sample size per group. x_lab character string indicating x-axis label plot. Default "Effect size". y_lab character string indicating y-axis label plot. Default "Standard error". x_ticks numeric vector indicating tick marks x-axis. Default NULL. Odds/ risk ratios log-transformed. y_ticks numeric vector indicating tick marks y-axis. Default NULL. legend_pos character string indicating position legend plot. Default "right". Can "top", "right", "bottom", "left". legend_just character string indicating legend justification relation 'legend_pos' argument. Default NULL. .e. 'legend_pos' "right" 'legend_just' top, legend appear top right corner plot. exp logical value indicating whether x-axis logarithmic scale (case odds/ risk ratios provided). Default FALSE.

title: Create Extended Funnel Plots — extfunnel2
text: extended funnel plot (ggplot2 object) shaded contours show impact new study certain effect estimate standard error (sample size) conclusions updated meta-analysis.

title: Create Extended Funnel Plots — extfunnel2
text: Langan, D. (2013). extfunnel. R package version 1.3. https://cran.r-project.org/package=extfunnel Langan, D., Higgins, J. P. T., Gregory, W., & Sutton, . J. (2012). Graphical augmentations funnel plot assess impact additional evidence meta-analysis. Journal Clinical Epidemiology, 65(5), 511–519. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclinepi.2011.10.009 Ferreira, M. L., Herbert, R. D., Crowther, M. J., Verhagen, ., & Sutton, . J. (2012). clinical trial justified? BMJ, 345, e5913. https://doi.org/10.1136/bmj.e5913 Wickham, H. (2016). ggplot2: Elegant Graphics Data Analysis. Springer-Verlag New York. https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org Viechtbauer, W. (2010). Conducting meta-analyses R metafor package. Journal Statistical Software, 36(3), 1-48. https://doi.org/10.18637/jss.v036.i03

title: Create Extended Funnel Plots — extfunnel2
code: # Load package once installed library(extfunnel2)  # Reproducing the extended funnel plot from Ferreira et al. 2012 # Random effects meta-analysis (effect of exercise on chronic low back pain) data <- data.frame(yi = c(-10.0, -16.3, -27.0, -14.0, -15.1, -2.1, -19.0, -8.7),                    sei = c(3.4, 5.8, 3.4, 5.3, 2.9, 1.1, 7.2, 4.2),                    ni = c(174.0, 35.0, 25.0, 30.5, 13.5, 34.0, 15.0, 86.0))  # Create extended funnel plot # Standard error on y-axis extfunnel2(data$yi, data$sei,            swe = -20,            method = "DL",            contour_points = 50,            x_lim = c(-40, 10), y_lim = c(0, 15),            x_ticks = seq(from = -40, to = 10, by = 10),            y_ticks = seq(from = 0, to = 15, by = 3),            x_lab = "Effect on pain (100 point scale)",            legend_pos = "none"            )    # Sample size per group on y-axis  # Assumptions: Equal group sizes and fixed SD  extfunnel2(data$yi, data$sei,             sd = 15, n = data$ni,             swe = -20,             method = "DL",             contour_points = 50,             x_lim = c(-40, 10), y_lim = c(10, 1000),             x_ticks = seq(from = -40, to = 10, by = 10),             y_ticks = seq(from = 0, to = 1000, by = 200),             x_lab = "Effect on pain (100 point scale)",             y_lab = "Sample size per group",             legend_pos = "none"             )    # With legend  extfunnel2(data$yi, data$sei,             sd = 15, n = data$ni,             swe = -20,             method = "DL",             contour_points = 50,             x_lim = c(-40, 10), y_lim = c(10, 1000),             x_ticks = seq(from = -40, to = 10, by = 10),             y_ticks = seq(from = 0, to = 1000, by = 200),             x_lab = "Effect on pain (100 point scale)",             y_lab = "Sample size per group",             legend_just = "top"             )
